bibl.title: Junichi Yamamoto v. Luther Weedin. Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF JUNICHI YAMAMOTO FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS

IT APPEARING to the court that an order has heretofore, to wit, on May 6th, 1922, been entered herein denying the writ of habeas corpus prayed for in the petitioner's petition herein, and it further appearing to the court that it was provided in said order that the pet- itioner should have thirty (3) days in which to appeal from said order to the Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, and it further appearing to the court that no such appeal has been taken or commenced within said thirty days or at all, and it further appearing that said petitioner has been released on bond pending the deter- mination of this proceeding; now, therefore,

IT IS ORDERED that said petitioner be, and he is hereby, directed to forthwith surrender himself unto the custody of the respondent herein, Luther Weedin, United States Commissioner of Immigration, at Seattle, Washington, to be deported in accordance with a warrant of deportation heretofore issued and executed by the Secretary of Labor or the United States.
DONE in open court this 12th day of July, 1922.
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON
IN RE APPLICATION OF J. YAMAMOTO FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS
FILED IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT
